description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期的院辖市，为当时中国的首都或名义上的首都之一。1949年后被中华人民共和国改名为北京市。
description.en: A Yuan-controlled municipality during the mainland period of the Republic of China, serving as one of its capitals. It was renamed Beijing by the People's Republic of China after 1949.

description.zh-cn: 成立于1912年的亚洲共和国，在中国大陆的统治于1949年结束。
description.en: A republic in Asia founded in 1912, whose rule on the mainland ended in 1949.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府，由中国国民党建立，是1925年至1948年间中华民国的国家政府。
description.en: The Nationalist Government of the Republic of China, established by the Kuomintang, was the national government of the Republic of China between 1925 and 1948.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国北洋政府时期首都北京的特别行政区划，前身为清代顺天府。
description.en: A special administrative area for the capital, Beijing, during the Beiyang Government of the Republic of China, formerly the Shuntian Prefecture of the Qing Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 由中国国民党领导的国民革命军针对北洋军阀的军事行动，旨在统一中国。
description.en: A military campaign led by the National Revolutionary Army of the Kuomintang against the Beiyang warlords, aimed at unifying China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期的一个省份。
description.en: A province during the Republic of China era.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府的最高行政机关。
description.en: The highest administrative body of the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 标志着中国抗日战争全面爆发的军事冲突。
description.en: A military conflict that marked the beginning of the full-scale Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 东亚国家，在二战期间侵略中国。
description.en: An East Asian country that invaded China during World War II.

nodes.id: 中华民国临时政府 (1937年—1940年)

zh-cn: 中华民国临时政府 (1937年—1940年)
en: Provisional Government of the Republic of China (1937–1940)

description.zh-cn: 日本在华北地区扶植的傀儡政权。
description.en: A puppet state established by Japan in North China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民革命军将领，于1945年光复北平。
description.en: A general of the National Revolutionary Army of the Republic of China who recovered Peiping in 1945.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国军将领，1949年率部投降中国共产党，促成北平和平解放。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China Armed Forces who surrendered to the Communist Party of China in 1949, leading to the peaceful liberation of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling party of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 指1949年1月傅作义率部投降，中国人民解放军和平进入北平的事件。
description.en: Refers to the event in January 1949 when Fu Zuoyi surrendered his troops and the People's Liberation Army entered Peiping peacefully.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的武装力量。
description.en: The armed forces of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中国人民政治协商会议第一届全体会议

zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议第一届全体会议
en: First Plenary Session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference

description.zh-cn: 1949年9月在北京召开的会议，为中华人民共和国的成立做准备，并通过决议将北平改名为北京并定为首都。
description.en: A conference held in Beijing in September 1949 to prepare for the founding of the People's Republic of China, which passed a resolution to rename Peiping to Beijing and establish it as the capital.

nodes.id: 关于中华人民共和国国都、纪年、国歌、国旗的决议

zh-cn: 关于中华人民共和国国都、纪年、国歌、国旗的决议
en: Resolution on the Capital, Calendar, National Anthem, and National Flag of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 由中国人民政治协商会议第一届全体会议通过，正式将北平改名为北京并定为中华人民共和国首都。
description.en: Passed by the First Plenary Session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, officially renaming Peiping to Beijing and establishing it as the capital of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的首都和直辖市，由原北平市改名而来。
description.en: The capital and a municipality of the People's Republic of China, renamed from the former Peiping City.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾任北平特别市市长。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China who served as the mayor of Peiping Special Municipality.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事及政治人物，曾任北平特别市市长。
description.en: A military and political figure of the Republic of China who served as the mayor of Peiping Special Municipality.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾任北平市市长。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China who served as the mayor of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾任北平市市长。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China who served as the mayor of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事及政治人物，曾任北平市市长。
description.en: A military and political figure of the Republic of China who served as the mayor of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，曾短暂担任北平市市长。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China who briefly served as the mayor of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事及政治人物，曾任北平市市长。
description.en: A military and political figure of the Republic of China who served as the mayor of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾任北平市市长。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China who served as the mayor of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事人物，最后一任中华民国北平市市长。
description.en: A military figure of the Republic of China and the last mayor of Peiping under the ROC.

nodes.id: 中国人民解放军北平市军事管制委员会

zh-cn: 中国人民解放军北平市军事管制委员会
en: Peiping Municipal Military Control Committee of the People's Liberation Army

description.zh-cn: 在北平和平解放后，由中国人民解放军成立的负责接管和管理北平市的临时权力机构。
description.en: A provisional authority established by the People's Liberation Army to take over and administer Peiping after its peaceful liberation.

description.zh-cn: 国民革命军在二次北伐中攻占北京，随后国民政府废除京兆地方，改名为北平并成立北平特别市。
description.en: The National Revolutionary Army captured Beijing during the Second Northern Expedition, after which the Nationalist Government abolished the Jingzhao Special Area, renamed it Peiping, and established the Peiping Special Municipality.

description.zh-cn: 国民政府决定将京都更名为北平，并设立北平特别市，直隶国民政府。
description.en: The Nationalist Government decided to rename the capital Kyoto to Peiping and established the Peiping Special Municipality, directly under its jurisdiction.

description.zh-cn: 北平市是在废除京兆地方后，在其原地域上改名设立的。
description.en: Peiping City was established by renaming the former Jingzhao Special Area after its abolition.

description.zh-cn: 北平市在大部分时期作为院辖市，直隶于行政院，但在1930年6月至11月期间曾短暂降为省辖市。
description.en: For most of its existence, Peiping was a Yuan-controlled municipality directly under the Executive Yuan, except for a brief period from June to November 1930 when it was demoted to a provincial-controlled city.

description.zh-cn: 1930年6月，北平市曾短暂降为河北省的省辖市。
description.en: In June 1930, Peiping City was briefly demoted to a provincial-controlled city of Hebei Province.

description.zh-cn: 七七事变后，日军攻占北平，中断了中华民国政府对该市的统治，直至1945年日本投降。
description.en: After the Marco Polo Bridge Incident, the Japanese army occupied Peiping, interrupting the rule of the Republic of China government over the city until Japan's surrender in 1945.

relationships.target: 中华民国临时政府 (1937年—1940年)

description.zh-cn: 日本在中国华北地区扶持建立了中华民国临时政府这一傀儡政权。
description.en: Japan supported the establishment of the Provisional Government of the Republic of China, a puppet state, in North China.

relationships.source: 中华民国临时政府 (1937年—1940年)

description.zh-cn: 在日本扶持的中华民国临时政府统治下，北平被改名为“北京”。
description.en: Under the rule of the Japanese-backed Provisional Government, Peiping was renamed 'Beijing'.

description.zh-cn: 率领国民革命军光复北平，恢复了中华民国政府对该市的统治。
description.en: Led the National Revolutionary Army to recover Peiping, restoring the rule of the Republic of China government over the city.

description.zh-cn: 率领25万国军守军向中国共产党投降，导致中华民国政府失去对北平市的控制。
description.en: Led 250,000 ROC troops to surrender to the Communist Party of China, causing the government of the Republic of China to lose control of Peiping City.

description.zh-cn: 与中国共产党达成和平协定并率部投降，促成了北平的和平解放。
description.en: Reached a peace agreement with the Communist Party of China and surrendered his troops, which led to the peaceful liberation of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 与傅作义达成和平协定，实现了北平的和平解放。
description.en: Reached a peace agreement with Fu Zuoyi, achieving the peaceful liberation of Peiping.

description.zh-cn: 在傅作义投降后和平进入北平城，完成了北平的和平解放。
description.en: Peacefully entered the city of Peiping after Fu Zuoyi's surrender, completing the peaceful liberation of the city.

relationships.source: 关于中华人民共和国国都、纪年、国歌、国旗的决议

description.zh-cn: 该决议将北平改名为北京，从而终止了“北平市”这一行政区划名称。
description.en: This resolution renamed Peiping to Beijing, thereby terminating the administrative division name 'Peiping City'.

relationships.source: 关于中华人民共和国国都、纪年、国歌、国旗的决议

description.zh-cn: 该决议将北平改名为北京，并定为中华人民共和国的首都，正式确立了“北京市”的名称和地位。
description.en: This resolution renamed Peiping to Beijing and established it as the capital of the People's Republic of China, formally establishing the name and status of 'Beijing Municipality'.

relationships.source: 中国人民政治协商会议第一届全体会议
relationships.target: 关于中华人民共和国国都、纪年、国歌、国旗的决议

description.zh-cn: 在此次会议上通过了《关于中华人民共和国国都、纪年、国歌、国旗的决议》。
description.en: The 'Resolution on the Capital, Calendar, National Anthem, and National Flag of the People's Republic of China' was passed during this session.

relationships.source: 中国人民解放军北平市军事管制委员会

description.zh-cn: 在北平沦陷后，该委员会接管了北平市的市政管理。
description.en: After the fall of Peiping, this committee took over the municipal administration of the city.
